perturbation.original_text: 4. Voting Commitments. The White Hat Parties shall appear in person or by proxy for quorum purposes at the 2020 Annual Meeting, including any adjournment or postponement thereof, to vote all of the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the White Hat Parties on the record date (if the 2020 Annual Meeting is within thirty (30) days of the anniversary of the Company's 2019 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, such number of shares shall be no less than 90% of the Current Position) for such meeting (i) in favor of all persons nominated by the Board to serve as directors of the Company and against any stockholder nominated candidate not endorsed by the Board, (ii) against the stockholder proposal made pursuant to Rule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act as disclosed to the White Hat Parties prior to the execution of this Agreement, (iii) to ratify the appointment of the Company's independent registered public accounting firm, and (iv) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to the Company's "say-on-pay" proposal and new equity compensation plan (collectively, the "2020 Proposals"), provided, that with respect to the proposals described in clauses (ii) through (iv) of this Section 4, the White Hat Parties may vote in accordance with the recommendation of Institutional Shareholders Services to the extent such recommendation differs from the voting commitments set forth herein and provided that the White Hat Parties do not publicly disclose their vote on such proposals if it differs from the Board's recommendation; and provided, further, that White Hat Parties shall have the right to vote the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the White Hat Parties in their sole discretion with respect to all other proposals brought before the 2020 Annual Meeting. The White Hat Parties shall provide written evidence of the votes made in accordance with the foregoing sentence to the Company no later than ten business days before the 2020 Annual Meeting.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Voting Commitments. The White Hat Parties shall appear in person or by proxy for quorum purposes at the 2020 Annual Meeting, including any adjournment or postponement thereof, to vote up to 50% of the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the White Hat Parties on the record date for such meeting (i) in favor of all persons nominated by the Board to serve as directors of the Company and against any stockholder nominated candidate not endorsed by the Board, (ii) against the stockholder proposal made pursuant to Rule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act as disclosed to the White Hat Parties prior to the execution of this Agreement, (iii) to ratify the appointment of the Company's independent registered public accounting firm, and (iv) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to the Company's "say-on-pay" proposal and new equity compensation plan (collectively, the "2020 Proposals"), provided, that with respect to the proposals described in clauses (ii) through (iv) of this Section 4, the White Hat Parties may vote in accordance with their own discretion regardless of the recommendation of Institutional Shareholders Services; and provided, further, that White Hat Parties shall have the right to vote the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the White Hat Parties in their sole discretion with respect to all other proposals brought before the 2020 Annual Meeting. The White Hat Parties are not required to provide any evidence of votes made to the company.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates voting 'all' shares in accordance with certain conditions. The modified clause now limits the mandatory voting commitment to 'up to 50%' of shares and removes the condition of voting inline with Institutional Shareholders Services' recommendation, allowing them to vote at their own discretion. Also the requirement for evidence of voting is removed.

perturbation.original_text: 5. Support Period Covenants. Except as otherwise contemplated in this Agreement, at all times during the period commencing on the date hereof and ending on the date that is thirty (30) days prior to expiration of the advance notice period for the submission by stockholders of director nominations for consideration at the 2021 Annual Meeting as set forth in the Bylaws, the White Hat Parties shall not, and shall cause the White Hat Representatives not to, directly or indirectly, in any manner, alone or in concert with others: (a) attempt to call a special meeting of stockholders of the Company; or (b) make a request for any stockholder list or other Company books and records, whether pursuant to Section 220 of the Delaware General Corporation Law or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. Support Period Covenants. The White Hat Parties may, during the period commencing on the date hereof and ending on the date that is thirty (30) days prior to expiration of the advance notice period for the submission by stockholders of director nominations for consideration at the 2021 Annual Meeting as set forth in the Bylaws, the White Hat Parties may, if they deem it necessary for protecting their investment, attempt to call a special meeting of stockholders of the Company; or make a request for any stockholder list or other Company books and records, whether pursuant to Section 220 of the Delaware General Corporation Law or otherwise. The company will attempt to assist in providing the mentioned information to the best of their abilities.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause strictly prohibits calling a special meeting or requesting stockholder lists. The modified clause now allows these actions 'if they deem it necessary,' creating a contradiction and uncertainty about when these restrictions apply. The addition of 'The company will attempt to assist' also introduces an ambiguity as to the extent of the companies assistance.

perturbation.original_text: 7. Miscellaneous. (c) Successors and Assigns. This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be binding upon the successors and assigns of each of the parties. This Agreement may not be assigned without the prior written consent of the other Party hereto.
perturbation.changed_text: 7. Miscellaneous. (c) Successors and Assigns. This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be binding upon the successors and assigns of each of the parties. This Agreement may be assigned to any party the assignor wishes, without consent, if a written notice is provided.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause requires 'prior written consent' for assignment. The modified clause allows assignment 'without consent' if written notice is provided. This creates a direct conflict about whether consent is required or not, leading to uncertainty.
